basics.name: Julia Robe, MSc
basics.label: Quantitative Analyst
basics.summary: Highly motivated data analyst with a strong background in quantitative research and proficiency in Python, SQL, data visualization tools, and machine learning fundamentals. I derive actionable insights from complex data sets and am passionate about optimizing processes and fostering a data-forward culture.

education.institution: University of New Orleans, New Orleans, LA

work.summary: Analyzed spectroscopic data from the Mapping Nearby Galaxies at APO (MaNGA) to investigate galaxy properties and better understand their formation history and evolution.
highlights: •	Processed and analyzed complex spectroscopic data from 300+ galaxies, demonstrating ability to handle large datasets.
•	Wrote Python scripts to analyze, visualize, and interpret the data, extracting findings to inform scientific conclusions.
•	Utilized bootstrap resampling and cross-validation techniques to ensure model robustness and accuracy in predictions.
•	Applied regression analysis and modeling techniques to understand complex relationships in large datasets.
•	Employed data correction methods to ensure data quality and accuracy in large datasets.
•	Developed data visualizations with Matplotlib and Seaborn to communicate insights and trends.
•	Uncovered key trends and correlations in large astronomical datasets, informing conclusions on galaxy evolution.

work.summary: Validated the Large Aperture Telescope Receiver for Simons Observatory and deployed the receiver to Chile.
highlights: •	Validated RF chain performance by executing a test protocol using a Vector Network Analyzer, collecting and analyzing output signals, and visualizing results.

•	Designed and built an optical chopper, generating a consistent, optically “chopped” signal to test for cross-polarization effects, and analyzed resulting data to forecast potential polarization-related anomalies.

•	Coordinated data analysis with multiple collaborators, including fellow graduate researchers, senior scientists, and stakeholders with non-technical backgrounds across three institutions, to validate findings and draw meaningful conclusions.
•	Developed and tested existing hardware solutions to improve research capabilities.
•	Obtained hands-on experience with sub-kelvin cryogenic, electrical, mechanical, and RF engineering.
•	Operated and maintained complex cryogenics and vacuum systems, ensuring seamless research operations.
•	Adapted to changing project requirements and tight deadlines, prioritizing tasks and managing time effectively to ensure timely deployment.
